titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that equitable mental health care benefits must be included in any health care reform legislation passed by Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 8/4/1995--Introduced. Declares that it is the sense of the Congress that any legislation enacted to reform the health care system must: (1) ensure that every person has access to coverage for medically and psychologically necessary treatments for mental disorders that is equivalent to the coverage provided for treatments of physical illnesses; and (2) meet specified requirements concerning coverage, consumer choice, financial protection, financing policies, and coordination across Federal, State, and local programs.
